steps.title: â€œGlooksâ€ is a slang term for â€œgood looking out.â€
steps.content: â€œGlooksâ€ is a slang term for â€œgood looking out.â€ Itâ€™s a combination of the words â€œgoodâ€ and â€œlooks,â€ and itâ€™s used to express gratitude or show you appreciate something someone has done. The word â€œglooksâ€ is an example of blending , a linguistics term for when 2 or more words are combined to form a new word â€”as in â€œbrunchâ€ (â€œbreakfastâ€ + â€œlunchâ€) or â€œsmogâ€ (â€œsmokeâ€ + â€œfogâ€). steps.title: â€œGlooksâ€ probably started in New York City.
steps.content: â€œGlooksâ€ probably started in New York City. Youâ€™ve probably heard the phrase â€œgood looking out,â€ but in the Big Apple, where everyone moves a mile a minute, you say â€œgood looks.â€ [2] X Research source â€œGlooksâ€ is then an even more efficient form of the phraseâ€”but whether â€œglooksâ€ itself originated in NYC is unclear.

steps.title: Use it to express thanks.
steps.content: Use it to express thanks. When someone does you a favor, show you appreciate it with a quick and casual â€œglooks.â€ You can use it over text: â€œhey man whatâ€™d i miss in class today?â€ â€œi gotchu, iâ€™ll send over my notesâ€ â€œglooks bro!â€ On social media: â€œhey cutie! love the new selfie! ğŸ˜˜â€ â€œaww glooks babe! ğŸ’‹â€ Or aloud in everyday conversation: â€œHey, watch out for that car!â€ â€œGlooks, man! I wasnâ€™t watching where I was going.â€

steps.title: "Glook" may refer to the vintage Glook Gonk doll.
steps.content: "Glook" may refer to the vintage Glook Gonk doll. In the 1960s, the Gonk doll was introduced in the UK by inventor Robert Benson. Gonk dolls consist of a small, spherical body, long fur, and googly eyes, and they come in many varieties, one of which is called the "Glook Gonk."
